definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions

sentences.english: The price of the public shares' currency must be fair and marketable.
sentences.chinese: 公股流通的价格要公平和市场化。

definition: public enterprise, as opposed to private enterprise 私營企業|私营企业[si1 ying2 qi3 ye4]
Executive Yuan, the executive branch of government under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
to set apart/to assign sb to a job
to decide (in a meeting)/to resolve (i.e. pass a resolution)
Lunbei or Lunpei township in Yunlin county 雲林縣|云林县[Yun2 lin2 xian4], Taiwan
to hold a (business) meeting/to start negotiations
referendum/abbr. for 公民投票[gong1 min2 tou2 piao4]
DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. to 民進黨|民进党
